answers.answer: Hi,Causes of numbness and tingling in the hands could be pressure on spinal nerves, pressure on peripheral nerves, diabetes, multiple sclerosis, underactive thyroid, Raynaud’s phenomenon, electrolyte imbalance, vitamin B12 deficiency, toxic nerve damage and many others. Please consult a physician and neurologist for complete examination, investigations and diagnosis. Hope this helps you. Take care and regards!

question: I have pins & needles & numbness in my hands, thumbs and fingers, apart from my little fingers, permanently.  Probably worse first thing in the morning.   This started about 12 months ago.  I am a 60 year old male. Any ideas what it might be?
title: PINS & NEEDLES & NUMBNESS IN BOTH HANDS & FINGERS
